data.title: Super Bowl Halftime Show 2024 Set List: What Usher songs will likely be featured in this year's Halftime Show?
data.meta_description:
Usher will perform 2024's esteemed half-time show at the Super Bowl but which exact tracks is he likely to perform?
The performance will come just days after he releases his n
data.text:
Usher will perform 2024's esteemed half-time show at the Super Bowl but which exact tracks is he likely to perform?

The performance will come just days after he releases his next album on February 11, or 12, which coincides with either the night before or the actual day of the game itself.

RELATED:

Super Bowl 2024: date, time, halftime show and everything you want to know

What time is the Super Bowl 2024 starting? How to watch online and TV channel in the USA

Super Bowl Halftime Show 2024: What we know so far about this year's Halftime Show

Super Bowl Winners List: All the teams that have ever won the Super Bowl

The game will be played at the Allegiant Stadium, home of the Las Vegas Raiders, and will be a sell-out meaning that Usher show his talent in from of 65000 spectators whilst the NFL stars take a much needed break.

Usher, whose full name is Usher Raymond IV, is an American singer, songwriter, actor, and dancer, born on October 14, 1978, in Dallas, Texas.

He rose to fame in the late 1990s with hits like "You Make Me Wanna..." and "Nice & Slow". Usher is known for his smooth R&B vocals, innovative dance moves, and chart-topping albums.

With numerous Grammy Awards to his name, he has sold millions of records worldwide. Besides music, Usher has ventured into acting, appearing in films and television shows. His impact on contemporary R&B and pop culture has solidified his status as an influential artist.

Thus that makes him a good selection for the event, which has previously seen huge names such as The Black Eyed Peas (whom Usher collaborated with), Madonna, Beyonce and Dr. Dre, Snoop Dogg, Eminem, Mary J. Blige and Kendrick Lamar perform.

Here is the speculated set list

As per The Athletic, here are the songs that Usher is thought to be singing at the Allegiant Stadium in Las Vegas, Nevada.

All of these songs are rated with a 60% chance or higher probability of being performed during the contest between the AFC and NFC winners:

Yeah!

Confessions, Part II

Good Good

U Don't Have to Call

You Make Me Wanna

U Remind Me

OMG
